poem:
Title: "The Scalded Earth"

Hail 2023, scorcher year supreme,
Where iron sun struck hard and mean.
Marked by fires blaze and ocean's steam,
A hellish portrait, humanity's dream.

A warming cloak of gas and coal,
Ignited in the world's soul,
Wrought by the craft of human tole,
Where earth once green, now red as a stove's coal.

Thermometer's siren, our somber song,
In climate's choir, we sing along.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
